Understanding Topics

The Topic component allows threaded conversations to be associated with specific StarTeam folders in the folder hierarchy. Each threaded conversation starts with a posted message (topic) that is followed by a series of responses, creating a conversation on a specific subject.

A topic and its responses generally appear in the form of a topic tree, with the topic as its root. The topic tree hierarchy clearly shows whether a particular response is a reply to the topic or a reply to another response. Topics may also be shown in list format.

Topics can raise general questions about the project or start highly technical discussions about such subjects as feature implementation. These conversations often lead to resolution of the issues, and their historical value to the project may also be significant.

Current team members can:

  • Search topics and responses for specific words or phrases.

  • Sort topics and responses.

  • Filter topics and responses

  • See the relationships between a topic and its responses.

  • Move and share topics (when using the tree format).

By reading topics created in the past, future team members can:

  • Reassess decisions in light of prior activity.

  • Avoid retrying solutions that were previously found faulty.

  • Understand why a particular solution to a problem became necessary.

Important: The Help system explains how to use the standard property dialog to create and edit topics and responses. Depending on how your team has set up the application, you may see a totally different dialog called an alternate property editor (APE).
